item.title: Objects and Classes
item.description:
==Where does it come from?==

Introduction to Redis

Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source.

item.title: Everything Is Art
item.description:
Everything that we do in life can be seen as a form of art.

Art is not limited to what hangs on a wall or plays through speakers. It lives in the ordinary. In the stillness. In everything that makes us feel alive.

It’s there when you solve a difficult calculus problem after failing multiple times.

It’s in the way your friend explains a confusing concept to you the night before an exam, with urgency and a little laughter.

item.title: What If Everything You Knew Was Built on Sand?
item.description:
First Principles Thinking: A Way Back to Clarity

Imagine you’re a time traveler. You land 5,000 years ago, in a quiet village with no electricity, no internet, no government. Just people figuring life out.

You try to explain money.
They look confused. You hold up a ₹500 note.
“It’s just paper,” they say. And they’re right.

You try to explain democracy.
“So… people vote, and the most popular person becomes the leader?”
They laugh. “That sounds risky.”

item.title: The Search Itself is the Answer
item.description:
Sometimes, I stare at the ceiling and wonder.

It usually happens late at night, when the world is quiet and I’m too tired to scroll, but not tired enough to sleep. My mind drifts. I think about life, not in a dramatic way, just… ==what’s the point of all this?== The routines, the rush, the responsibilities. The little wins. The quiet struggles. Why do we wake up every day and do it all over again?

item.title: Finally, I Hit Publish
item.description:
Four years. That’s how long it took me to hit publish.

I hesitated, second-guessed, and overthought for years, but I’ve finally gathered the courage to put myself out there and start writing publicly about the things that fascinate and intrigue me.

Since my freshman year of college, I kept hearing from people I admire:“You should write more”. But I never had the courage to actually do it. I’ve always been a private person. No active social media presence, no hot takes on the internet, nothing. I kept most of my thoughts to myself.
